content: top of the cedars designed by richard boxhall top of the cedars this is a baby version of my adult tree hats spruce and where the forest meets the sky the hat can be made with regular stranded knitting or ladderback jackard the latter gives great results for high contrast wool but requires a bit more work i have included a plain chart and a chart detailing the ladderback jackard stitches if you re unsure about ladderback jackard this video is the best i ve seen for detailing the technique https //youtu be/iltugy_m-ds si=uxjr_8ctsd7hff0w fit one size hat is made 30cm circumference to fit babies newborn to 12 months yarn hat is made with fingering yarn a dark 15g / 53m / 57yds b light 15g / 53m / 57yds suggested yarn two shades of superwash fingering yarn that can be knit to gauge needles 2 5mm us 1 5 circular or double pointed knitting needles 3mm us 2 5 circular or double pointed knitting needles tapestry needle gauge 28 stitches = 10cm in stockinette stitch instructions 1 using 2 5mm needles cast on 84 stitches join in the round being careful not to twist the stitches 2 knit ribbing either 1k 1p or 2k 2p and continue until ribbing measures 3cm or 6cm for folded brim 3 with 3mm needles or size required for gauge knit one round in stockinette stitch place markers for start of each round and every 14 stitches 0 14 28 42 56 70 use a unique marker for 42 to mark the start of the pattern if using ladderback jackard set up the jackard stitches in this round every three stitches i made this this is a short ladderback as it s a baby hat 4 knit chart either follow plain chart or ladderback jackard chart repeated once each round i recommend strikethrough each completed row i e with pen and ruler to help you navigate the chart if knitting stranded do not exceed three stiches of float ensure floats are not vertically aligned to avoid bunching if knitting ladderback jackard complete the ladderback jackard on row 20 round will be knit 2 ssk repeated for the whole round you should have 84 stitches on your needle at the end of the round 5 continue knitting in the round to row 25 decrease as follows you will need to switch to double-pointed needles or magic loop to finish the top of the hat round 1 knit 12 knit 2 together repeat to end of round 78 stitches round 2 knit round round 3 knit 11 knit 2 together repeat to end of round 72 stitches round 4 knit round round 5 knit 10 knit 2 together repeat to end of round 66 stitches round 7 knit 9 knit 2 together repeat to end of round 60 stitches continue to decrease every round until
